Description: Fragment from body of Attic black-figured small, globular pottery vessel; glazed very thin and matt on the interior. Caprid leaping to right; its forelegs and two incised rosettes in the field remain; added red for dots on alternate petals of the rosettes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 57, no. 199 pl. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2007)
